meanings.definition: The quality or state of being circular.
meanings.sent1: The circularities of the wheel made it perfect for the race.
meanings.sent2: The circularities of the design gave it a unique look.
meanings.sent3: The circularities of the conversation left everyone dizzy.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved in circularities, never reaching a conclusion.
meanings.sent5: The circularities of the maze confused the participants.

meanings.sent1: His circularities in the debate made it hard to follow his point.
meanings.sent2: The circularities in his explanation led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: The circularities in their discussion went around in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her circularities of thought kept her stuck in the same place.
meanings.sent5: The circularities in his reasoning were evident to all.

meanings.definition: The use of circular language or logic.
meanings.sent1: The circularities in her writing style were hard to decipher.
meanings.sent2: His speech was full of circularities that frustrated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The circularities in the contract made it difficult to understand.
meanings.sent4: Their circularities of thought led to a dead-end in the discussion.
meanings.sent5: The circularities in his argument made it hard to follow his train of thought.
